name: subsidy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 money given as part of the cost of something, to help or encourage it to happen: The company received a substantial government subsidy. The government is planning to abolish subsidies to farmers.
More examplesFewer examplesstate subsidiesThe steel industry was at the time coddled by trade protection and massive subsidies.They are planning in increase housing subsidies for the poor.Companies who recruit through the scheme will receive a subsidy of £50 a week.It may be eligible for a government subsidy.

The Energy Act provides billions of dollars in subsidies for the nuclear, oil, gas and coal industries.cut/eliminate/reduce subsidies The government has cut subsidies on electricity and petrol.
